radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple T2-hyperintense lesions in the pons, paraventricular region, and corpus callosum without gadolinium enhancement.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased T2-lesion load and one Gd-enhancing lesion in the pons were noted at 3-year follow-up.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Typical features of herpes simplex encephalitis.
Normal hearing on the left side with a 30 dB loss at 8 kHz, right side showed linear sloping loss from 1.5 kHz reaching 40 dB at 8 kHz.
Tachycardia to the 130s, ejection fraction of 42% with segmental left ventricular dysfunction.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Tachycardia normalized approximately 2 hours after the onset, following medication.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Meningioma of the right sphenoid wing.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Beginning tentorial herniation was noted after the onset of symptoms post-surgery.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Right-sided edema with diffuse contrast enhancement.
Normal with no abnormalities of absolute or interwave latencies.
